triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy Section 4.1 states that the maximum LTV for Tier B is 90%. The calculated LTV for this application is 91.11%, which exceeds the limit.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider adjusting the loan terms or reducing the loan amount to meet the DTI requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy Section 3.1 states that the maximum DTI for Tier B is 40%. The calculated DTI for this application is 41.25%, which exceeds the limit.

content.reasoning: The analysis identified two medium-severity issues: the Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio exceeds the policy limit for the applicant's credit tier, and the Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio also surpasses the allowable threshold. These findings suggest that the current loan terms may pose a financial risk and require adjustments to align with policy guidelines.
